You can consider a 5-star rated LG refrigerator or Voltas Inverter AC. Look for BEE star ratings when buying!
Inverter ACs, front-load washing machines, and LED bulbs are great energy-saving options.
Always check for BEE star ratings and avoid using outdated appliances that consume more power.
Turn off appliances when not in use, use natural lighting, and replace old bulbs with LEDs.
Unplug chargers, use ceiling fans instead of ACs, and wash clothes in cold water to reduce power use.

Under the UJALA scheme, you can buy subsidized LED bulbs, tube lights, and fans at affordable rates.
UJALA (Unnat Jyoti by Affordable LEDs for All) promotes energy efficiency across India with government support.
Visit https://eeslindia.org or your local electricity board for UJALA scheme availability.
Wind energy uses turbines to convert wind into electricity. It's clean and renewable.
Wind turbines are an efficient way to produce electricity without pollution.
Wind power is growing globally and helps reduce dependence on fossil fuels.
Geothermal energy taps into Earth's internal heat for power and heating.
It’s a sustainable energy source available 24/7 beneath the surface.
Geothermal systems are efficient and suitable for both electricity and heating.
Hydropower uses flowing water to generate electricity, often via dams.
It is a clean and reliable source of renewable energy.
India has many hydroelectric power stations generating clean electricity.
Bioenergy comes from organic material like plants and waste. It’s a powerful renewable source.
Biomass can be converted into heat, electricity, or biofuels for transportation.
Bioenergy reduces agricultural waste and offers a low-carbon alternative to fossil fuels.
Using renewable energy helps reduce pollution, fight climate change, and protect our environment.
Switching to clean energy supports a greener and more sustainable future.
Energy efficiency and renewables are key to preserving the environment for future generations.
There are several renewable sources: solar, wind, hydro, geothermal, and bioenergy.
Clean energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources.
Each renewable type plays a role in reducing emissions and dependence on fossil fuels.
